ovdesc.p: This is a live file holding the historical information of the bill. Bills are generated prior to payments. These bills hold all the details of the payment and different status it would undergo. Bills are generated by the activity ISSUE.BILL.
Bills can be generated online for the payments made online like activity charges, charges for periodic rules etc. Bills are generated during cob for the scheduled payment.
Bills are generated prior to certain number of days before the payment date. The number of days is defined in the field BILL.PRODUCED in the payment schedule property.

Either individual bills or combined bills can be produced for each of the payment types. This is decided by the field BILLS.COMBINED in the payment schedule property. Bill details is updated when the payment date is made due, aging, suspension, repayment.

Bank related fields will updated on and after the charge off arrangement. Once charge off is done then customer balances will be stored in existing amount related fields and Bank balances will be stored in BNK (bank) fields.

desc.p: This field represent the aging status the bill underwent. This field is associated with the AGING.ST.CHG.DT field.
The aging activity would update this field.
The aging statuses are defined in the EB.LOOKUP file.
When bill is deemed to be settled, that is DELIN.OS.AMT is zero, the aging status is updated as SETTLED and the bill is not considered for further aging if the field AGE.BILLS is set as BILL.STATUS.

This field denotes the delinquent amount that has been settled by the repayment reference as part of delinquency processing

This field represents the delinquent outstanding amount. If the value in the field BILL.SETTLEMENT is BILL.TOTAL, the total outstanding amount is updated in the field DELIN.OS.AMT during aging. During repayment, the repayment amount is compared with the total outstanding amount of the selected bill and the difference is updated in the field.
If the repayment amount happens to be greater than or equal to total outstanding amount, the bill is deemed to be settled.
